SwingHelper

Method Detail

addArmedQuestionCheckboxes

public static void addArmedQuestionCheckboxes(javax.swing.JPanel armedPanel,
                                              javax.swing.JTextField ifYesField)
Adds armed check boxes and text used to inquire if a suspect was armed. It contains text reading "Armed?" along with two check boxes (one yes, one no). If the yes check box is selected a JTextField appears for the user to input the weapon.

Parameters:
armedPanel - - JPanel to add the Armed? question to
ifYesField - - JTextField to appear if yes check box is selected this JTextField must be set up and initialized by the calling class in order for entered text to be retrieved

addDateRangePanel

public static void addDateRangePanel(javax.swing.JComponent c)
Adds to the given JComponent two date spinners labeled "To" and "From". Used to specify a specific date range. The default range is -10 years from today's date through today's date.

Parameters:
c - - JComponent to add the date spinners to

addDateSpinner

public static javax.swing.JSpinner addDateSpinner(javax.swing.JComponent c,
                                                  java.lang.String label)
Adds a JSpinner used for selecting the a date to the given JComponent. The default range is -10 years from today's date through today's date.

Parameters:
c - - the JCompoent to add the date spinner to
label - - the text label to attach to the date spinner; set to "" to add an unlabeled date spinner
Returns:
the JSpinnerdate spinner added to the component

addLabeledSpinner

public static javax.swing.JSpinner addLabeledSpinner(java.awt.Container c,
                                                     java.lang.String label,
                                                     javax.swing.SpinnerModel model)
Creates a JSpinner with the specified label text from the given SpinnerModel and adds the JSpinner to the given Container.

Parameters:
c - - the container to add the spinner to
label - - the text which to add to the spinner
model - - the SpinnerModel to make the spinner from
Returns:
a JSpinner created from the SpinnerModel with the specified label text

addLabeledSpinner

public static javax.swing.JSpinner addLabeledSpinner(java.awt.Container c,
                                                     java.lang.String label,
                                                     javax.swing.SpinnerModel model,
                                                     boolean wrap)
Creates a JSpinner with the specified label text from the given SpinnerModel and adds the JSpinner to the given Container. If the wrap parameter is set to true, MigLayout's "wrap" attribute will be applied to the JTextField, meaning the next component added will appear on the next line. (Exception: Will not work if MigLayout's flowy layout constraint is applied, but it is rarely used MigLayout feature and thus not a common concern; however if you have set this layout constraint on your JComponent do not attempt to use the wrap option of this method.)

Parameters:
c - - the container to add the spinner to
label - - the text which to add to the spinner
model - - the SpinnerModel to make the spinner from
wrap - - indicates whether the MigLayout "wrap" attribute should be present when this JSpinner is added to the container; if component does not have the MigLayout as it's layout manager then this property has no effect
Returns:
a JSpinner created from the SpinnerModel with the specified label text

addLabeledTextField

public static javax.swing.JTextField addLabeledTextField(javax.swing.JComponent c,
                                                         java.lang.String label,
                                                         int length,
                                                         boolean wrap)
Adds a JTextField with the specified text as a label appearing before the text field to the given JComponent. Assuming the JComponent has the MigLayout set, the label and text field are both left aligned within the JComponent. If the wrap parameter is set to true, MigLayout's "wrap" attribute will be applied to the JTextField, meaning the next component added will appear on the next line. (Exception: Will not work if MigLayout's flowy layout constraint is applied, but it is rarely used MigLayout feature and thus not a common concern; however if you have set this layout constraint on your JComponent do not attempt to use the wrap option of this method.)

Parameters:
label - - the text to appear in front of the text field
length - - the length in columns of the text field
wrap - - indicates is this component should be the last on the current line
Returns:
the JTextField added to the component

addLineBorder

public static void addLineBorder(javax.swing.JComponent c)
Adds a basic black line border around the given component.

Parameters:
c - - the component to put the border around

addTimeSpinner

public static javax.swing.JSpinner addTimeSpinner(javax.swing.JComponent c,
                                                  java.lang.String label)
Adds a JSpinner used to select a time to the given JComponent.

Parameters:
c - - JComponent to add the time spinner to
label - - the text label to attach to the date spinner; set to "" to add an unlabeled time spinner

addTitledBorder

public static void addTitledBorder(javax.swing.JComponent c,
                                   java.lang.String title)
Adds a basic black line border with the specified title around the given component.

Parameters:
c - - the component to put the border around
title - - the title to give the titled border

addVerticalButtons

public static void addVerticalButtons(javax.swing.JPanel panel,
                                      javax.swing.JButton[] buttonArray)
Adds a line of vertical buttons to the given panel.

Parameters:
panel - - the JPanel to add the buttons to
buttonArray - - an array filled with buttons to add to panel

addVerticalLabeledButtons

public static void addVerticalLabeledButtons(javax.swing.JPanel panel,
                                             javax.swing.JButton[] buttonArray,
                                             java.lang.String[] labels)
Adds a line of vertical buttons with accompaning text to the given panel. The text will precede the panel and both buttons and panels will be left aligned.

Parameters:
panel - - the JPanel to add the buttons to
buttonArray - - an array filled with buttons to add to panel
labels - - an array filled with the text to precede each button Note: buttons and accompaning labels should be in the same order w/in their respective arrays

createDateRangePanel

public static javax.swing.JPanel createDateRangePanel()
Creates a JPanel containing two labeled date spinners labeled "To" and "From". Used to specify a specific date range. The default range is -10 years from today's date through today's date.

Returns:
a JPanel containing two date spinners used for specifying a date range

createDateSpinnerPanel

public static javax.swing.JPanel createDateSpinnerPanel()
Creates a JSpinner used for selecting the a date to the given JComponent. The default range is -10 years from today's date through today's date.

Returns:
a JPanel containing one date spinner used for specifying a date

createImageButton

public static javax.swing.JButton createImageButton(java.lang.String imagePath)
Creates and returns a new JButton with the image found at the given filename.In the case that no image is found at the given path, a JButton with no text or image will be returned.

Parameters:
buttonText - - the text to appear on the button
imagePath - - the pathname of the image to place on the button given relative to userinterface package.
Returns:
JButton with specified icon image and text

createImageButton

public static javax.swing.JButton createImageButton(java.lang.String buttonText,
                                                    java.lang.String imagePath)
Creates and returns a new JButton with the image found at the given filename and the given text. Image will appear on top and text will appear centered below the image. In the case that no image is found at the given path, a regular JButton with the given text will be returned.

Parameters:
buttonText - - the text to appear on the button
imagePath - - the pathname of the image to place on the button given relative to userinterface package.
Returns:
JButton with specified icon image and text

createImageLabel

public static javax.swing.JLabel createImageLabel(java.lang.String path)
Creates a JLabel containing the image located at the specified image path. Image path should be given relative to the userinterface package.

Parameters:
path - - the image's path relative to the userinterface package
Returns:
a JLabel containing the image or null if the path was invalid

createLabeledTextField

public static javax.swing.JPanel createLabeledTextField(java.lang.String label,
                                                        int length)
Creates a JTextField with the specified text as a label appearing before the text field.

Parameters:
label - - the text to appear in front of the text field
length - - the length in columns of the text field
Returns:
a JPanel with the labeled text field as the only element

createTimeSpinnerPanel

public static javax.swing.JPanel createTimeSpinnerPanel()
Creates a JPanel with a JSpinner to select a time.

Returns:
a JPanel containing one time spinner used for specifying a time

makeTextPanel

public static javax.swing.JPanel makeTextPanel(java.lang.String text)
Creates a JPanel containing the given text placed in the center as the only component.

Parameters:
text - - the text to put on the panel
Returns:
a JPanel containing only the given text
